api_contracts.description: Returns a simple greeting message with HTTP 200 status code

component_logic.responsibility: Initialize and configure the FastAPI HTTP server framework with routing infrastructure

interfaces.description: Create and return a configured FastAPI application instance
Register all route handlers with the FastAPI application

component_logic.implementation_notes: Use FastAPI 0.104+ to create the application instance. Configure with title='Hello World API' and version='1.0.0'. Set up CORS middleware if needed for cross-origin requests. Initialize the app with default settings (no custom middleware required for this minimal implementation). The app instance should be created at module level for use by route handlers.

component_logic.responsibility: Handle GET /hello requests and return a greeting message with proper response serialization

interfaces.description: Process GET /hello request and return greeting message as JSON

component_logic.implementation_notes: Implement as a FastAPI route handler decorated with @app.get('/hello'). Return a dictionary with key 'message' and value 'Hello World'. FastAPI automatically serializes the dictionary to JSON with Content-Type: application/json. The response status code defaults to 200 OK. No request body is expected or processed. Handler should be synchronous (not async) for this simple use case.

component_logic.responsibility: Format HTTP responses with appropriate status codes and content-type headers

interfaces.description: Format successful response data with 200 status code
Format error response with appropriate status code and error details

component_logic.implementation_notes: FastAPI handles response formatting automatically through Pydantic models or dict serialization. For success responses, return dict with data payload (e.g., {'message': 'Hello World'}). FastAPI sets Content-Type to application/json and status code to 200 by default. For error responses, use FastAPI's HTTPException with status_code parameter to set appropriate HTTP status (500 for internal errors). Include error_code and message in response body for client debugging. All responses should include proper Content-Type: application/json header (set automatically by FastAPI).

design_review_checklist.description: Verify HTTP server framework is properly initialized and routes are registered
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: HTTPServerFramework.create_app() must return a valid FastAPI instance. HTTPServerFramework.configure_routes() must register the /hello endpoint. The app must be accessible and listening on the configured port.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify route handler is correctly decorated and mapped to GET /hello
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: HelloRouteHandler.hello() must be decorated with @app.get('/hello'). HTTP method must be GET (not POST, PUT, DELETE). Route path must be exactly '/hello' with no trailing slash or parameters.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify response format is valid JSON with correct content-type
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: GET /hello must return Content-Type: application/json header. Response body must be valid JSON with structure {'message': 'Hello World'}. Status code must be 200 OK for successful requests.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify error responses are properly formatted with status codes
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: Internal server errors must return HTTP 500 status code. Error responses must include error_code and message fields. All error responses must be valid JSON.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify response serialization is efficient and uses FastAPI's built-in mechanisms
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: Response serialization must use FastAPI's automatic JSON encoding (not manual json.dumps()). No unnecessary data transformations or processing in the handler. Response time should be < 10ms for the /hello endpoint.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify component dependencies are correctly structured with no circular dependencies
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: HelloRouteHandler depends on HTTPServerFramework. ResponseFormatter has no dependencies. No circular dependency chains exist. Each component has a single, clear responsibility.

architecture_overview: Minimal three-tier architecture for a simple greeting API. HTTPServerFramework (SU-001) initializes the FastAPI application and sets up routing infrastructure. HelloRouteHandler (SU-002) implements the GET /hello endpoint that returns a JSON response with the greeting message. ResponseFormatter (SU-003) handles HTTP response formatting with appropriate status codes and content-type headers. FastAPI automatically handles JSON serialization, so no manual formatting is required. The application is stateless with no database or external dependencies.
assumptions: The application runs on a single process (no clustering required)
No authentication or authorization is needed for the /hello endpoint
No rate limiting is required for this minimal endpoint
The server listens on localhost:8000 by default (standard Uvicorn configuration)
No database or external service dependencies are required
The response message is exactly 'Hello World' with no variations
HTTPS/TLS is handled at infrastructure level (not in application code)
No request logging or monitoring is required beyond standard HTTP access logs
